intro: Thymelaea calycina var. pilosa, commonly known as the silky thymelaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rocky or dry garden environments. Its unique texture and ornamental value make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
